title: Pope Clement V imposes excommunication and interdiction on Venice, and a general prohibition of all commercial intercourse with Venice, which had seized on Ferrara, a papal fiefdom.

title: Charles Watson

text: • 1809 – Peninsular War: A combined Franco-Polish force defeats the Spanish in the Battle of Ciudad Real.

title: The first international rugby football match, when Scotland defeats England in Edinburgh at Raeburn Place.
text: • 1871 – The first international rugby football match, when Scotland defeats England in Edinburgh at Raeburn Place.

title: A mob in Cincinnati, Ohio, attacks members of a jury which had returned a verdict of manslaughter in what was seen as a clear case of murder; over the next few days the mob would riot and eventually destroy the courthouse.

text: • 1941 – World War II: Yugoslav Air Force officers topple the pro-Axis government in a bloodless coup.

text: • 1975 – Construction of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System begins.

title: Tenerife airport disaster: Two Boeing 747 airliners collide on a foggy runway on Tenerife in the Canary Islands, killing 583 (all 248 on KLM and 335 on Pan Am). Sixty
text: • 1977 – Tenerife airport disaster: Two Boeing 747 airliners collide on a foggy runway on Tenerife in the Canary Islands, killing 583 (all 248 on KLM and 335 on Pan Am). Sixty-one survived on the Pan Am flight. This is the deadliest aviation accident in history.
